modules.description: Provides functions to allocate and free socket structures, convert between protocol identifiers and integers, and establish or terminate connections using a specific protocol. Works with socket structures and protocol enumerations to manage low-level network communication. Used to create and control network sockets in systems programming contexts.

Manages memory-allocated data structures using Ctypes, providing operations to iterate over pointers and convert them to lists. Works with Ctypes_static.ptr and Ctypes.ptr types to interact with foreign memory. Used to safely traverse and extract elements from dynamically allocated memory blocks.

Converts between integer values and custom `stat_id` type, and manages network interface data structures. Operates on `t` for network interfaces, `stat_id` for statistics identifiers, and C-compatible data types via Ctypes. Provides low-level access to network cache operations, interface attributes, and statistical data retrieval.

Provides functions to allocate and iterate over address caches, convert cache entries to lists, and extract interface indices, labels, and local addresses from structured data. Operates on Ctypes-based structures representing network addresses and socket data. Used to manage and query address information in low-level networking contexts.

Handles low-level interactions with the Linux kernel's netlink protocol, including message encoding, decoding, and socket communication. Operates on raw netlink messages, attributes, and socket file descriptors. Enables real-time network configuration updates and device state monitoring.

manages low-level network communication and memory interactions through socket control, data structure traversal, and interface statistics. It handles socket structures, protocol conversions, Ctypes-based memory manipulation, and network address caching. Operations include allocating sockets, iterating over pointers, converting stat IDs, and extracting interface details. It enables systems programmers to control network interfaces, access cached addresses, and manage foreign memory safely.
